positions.subtitle: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur
positions.description: Working under the aegis of Dean and Associate Dean of International Relations, International Relations Cell thrives to improve the global footprint of IIT Kharagpur by conducting year-long activities for enhancing the mobility of students and faculty both inwards and outwards. Our major initiatives include the Foreign Training Program ( providing foreign internships to IIT Kharagpur students), Semester Exchange Program, Dyuti ( a week-long global village for international students), Young Innovators Program( an event enhancing the brand value of IIT Kharagpur among school students), competitions( Hult Prize), scholarships (ADSIP, SGRIP, ASEAN, GKF, IITKGPF)• Strategized the execution of first-ever International YIP, getting applause from the office of President of India• New Initiatives Executed: YIP, Hult Prize, GKF scholarship, Dyuti• Initiatives ideated: Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations at IIT Kharagpur
positions.title: Coordinator
positions.description_html:
Working under the aegis of Dean and Associate Dean of International Relations, International Relations Cell thrives to improve the global footprint of IIT Kharagpur by conducting year-long activities for enhancing the mobility of students and faculty both inwards and outwards. Our major initiatives include the Foreign Training Program ( providing foreign internships to IIT Kharagpur students), Semester Exchange Program, Dyuti ( a week-long global village for international students), Young Innovators Program( an event enhancing the brand value of IIT Kharagpur among school students), competitions( Hult Prize), scholarships (ADSIP, SGRIP, ASEAN, GKF, IITKGPF)
• Strategized the execution of first-ever International YIP, getting applause from the office of President of India
• New Initiatives Executed: YIP, Hult Prize, GKF scholarship, Dyuti
• Initiatives ideated: Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations at IIT Kharagpur

experience.title: Associate
experience.location: Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur Pin-721302, West Bengal, India
experience.description: Working under the Dean of Alumni Affairs and International Relations ,Team Students' Alumni Cell strives to establish and nurture the interaction between the Institute and the alumni. It has served as a platform facilitating communication between the current students of IIT Kharagpur and their predecessors. The team works on facets like Networking, Publications and Events with an objective to keep the alumni connected to their Alma Mater and updated about the latest happenings in the Institute.We organize events like the Annual Alumni Meet (Reunion), Regional Student-Alumni Meet, Guest Lectures and carry on programmes like the Student Alumni Mentorship to meet our objective.
experience.description_html: Working under the Dean of Alumni Affairs and International Relations ,Team Students' Alumni Cell strives to establish and nurture the interaction between the Institute and the alumni. It has served as a platform facilitating communication between the current students of IIT Kharagpur and their predecessors. The team works on facets like Networking, Publications and Events with an objective to keep the alumni connected to their Alma Mater and updated about the latest happenings in the Institute.We organize events like the Annual Alumni Meet (Reunion), Regional Student-Alumni Meet, Guest Lectures and carry on programmes like the Student Alumni Mentorship to meet our objective.

volunteer_experience.info:
The National Cadet Corps is an Indian military cadet corps with its Headquarters at New Delhi, Delhi, India. It is open to school and college students on voluntary basis. National Cadet Corps is a Tri-Services Organization, comprising the Army, Navy and Air Force, engaged in grooming the youth of the country into disciplined and patriotic citizens. The National Cadet Corps in India is a voluntary organization which recruits cadets from high schools, colleges and universities all over India. The…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          The National Cadet Corps is an Indian military cadet corps with its Headquarters at New Delhi, Delhi, India. It is open to school and college students on voluntary basis. National Cadet Corps is a Tri-Services Organization, comprising the Army, Navy and Air Force, engaged in grooming the youth of the country into disciplined and patriotic citizens. The National Cadet Corps in India is a voluntary organization which recruits cadets from high schools, colleges and universities all over India. The Cadets are given basic military training in small arms and parades.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
